choiceOption.toolTip: Selects the clock configuration used for ticks and time calculations

Allows selection of the polarity of the analog comparator function

CMP and DAC are configured to CMP Trigger mode. 
 CMP Trigger mode depends on an external timer resource to periodically enable 
 Upon setting TRIGM, the CMP and DAC are placed in a standby state until an

choiceOption.toolTip: Selects whether the output pin is driven by the filtered or unfiltered comparator output

intOption.toolTip: Specifies the output level of the internal DAC

binaryOption.description: Enable use of Seconds for time
binaryOption.toolTip: Use of floating point is necessary to support specifing CMP filter times in seconds in runtime code.\n If not needed, the overhead can be avoided by disabling this option

choice.name: 1 Disabled
choice.toolTip: Comparator is non-functional and consumes no power.\n CMPO is 0 in this mode.

choice.name: 2a/b Continuous
choice.toolTip:
Mode 2 - Continuous mode
 Both window control and filter blocks are completely bypassed. 
 COUTA,COUT are the output of the comparator, with optional inversion, but without sampling or filtering. 
 SCR[COUT] is updated continuously. 
 The path from comparator input pins is operating in combinational unclocked mode.

choice.name: 3a Externally sampled, Non-Filtered
choice.toolTip:
Mode 3a - Externally clocked Sampling, Non-Filtered
 Window control is bypassed. The filter block operates as a simple Sample and Hold 
 COUTA is the output of the comparator, with optional inversion, but without sampling or filtering. 
 COUT is COUTA after sampling. 
 The external window/sample input is used to clock the Sample and Hold

choice.name: 3b Internally sampled, Non-Filtered
choice.toolTip:
Mode 3a/b - Internally clock Sampling, Non-Filtered mode
 Window control is bypassed. The filter block operates as a simple Sample and Hold 
 COUTA is the output of the comparator, with optional inversion, but without sampling or filtering. 
 COUT is COUTA after sampling. 
 FILT_PER acts as a prescaler for the bus clock driving the Sample and Hold

choice.name: 4a Externally sampled, Filtered
choice.toolTip:
Mode 4a/b - Externally clocked Samping, Filtered mode
 Window control is bypassed. The filter is enabled (FILTER_CNT>1). 
 COUTA is the output of the comparator, with optional inversion, but without sampling or filtering. 
 COUT is COUTA after filtering. 
 The external window/sample input is used to clock the Filter.
 FILTER_CNT determines the filter sample count (width)

choice.name: 4b Internally sampled, Filtered
choice.toolTip:
Mode 4a/b - Internally clocked Sampling, Filtered
 Window control is bypassed. The filter is enabled (FILTER_CNT>1). 
 COUTA is the output of the comparator, with optional inversion, but without sampling or filtering. 
 COUT is COUTA after filtering. 
 FILT_PER acts as a prescaler for the bus clock driving the Filter
 FILTER_CNT determines the filter sample count (width)

choice.name: 5a/b Windowed
choice.toolTip:
Mode 5a/b - Windowed mode
 The comparator output is qualified by an external window signal. 
 COUTA is the windowed output of the comparator, with optional inversion. 
 When enabled by the window, the comparator output is clocked by the bus clock and held otherwise. 
 This introduces up to 1 clock delay.

choice.name: 6 Windowed, Re-sampled
choice.toolTip:
Mode 6 - Windowed/Resampled mode
 The comparator output is qualified by an external window signal and then resampled. 
 COUTA is the windowed output of the comparator, with optional inversion. 
 COUT is COUTA after sampling 
 When enabled by the window, the comparator output is clocked by the bus clock and then resampled at a 
 rate determined by the bus clock*FILT_PER to generate COUT.

choice.name: 7 Windowed, Filtered
choice.toolTip:
Mode 7 - Windowed/Filtered mode
 The comparator output is qualified by an external window signal and then filtered. 
 COUTA is the windowed output of the comparator, with optional inversion. 
 COUT is COUTA after filtering. 
 When enabled by the window, the comparator output is clocked by the bus clock and then filtered at a 
 sample rate determined by the FILT_PER to generate COUT.
 FILTER_CNT determines the filter sample count (width)

binaryOption.toolTip:
Enable the use of an external signal to qualify the comparator output (before filtering).
 The comparator output is held when the external signal is inactive and
 clocked directly by the bus clock when enabled.
 Usually a PDB output is available for this purpose.
Select between the divided bus clock and an external clock for the filter block

intOption.toolTip: Specifies the sampling period, in clock cycles, of the comparator output filter \n This has no effect if SE=1. In that case, the external SAMPLE signal is used to \n determine the sampling period.

floatOption.toolTip: The calculated sampling period of the comparator output filter \n This has no effect if SE=1. In that case, the external SAMPLE signal is used to \n determine the sampling period.

choiceOption.toolTip: Represents the number of consecutive samples that must agree prior \n to the comparator output filter accepting a new output state

floatOption.toolTip: The calculated interval of the comparator output filter (sample period*number of samples).

choiceOption.toolTip: Selects operation in sampling or windowed mode

intOption.toolTip: Returns the current value of the Analog Comparator output,
